Bonnie

>Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: truck repair question
>Date: Sun, 16 Jul 2000 19:08:38 -0700 (PDT)
>
>I asked my DH also and he said the same thing. I don't
>know where you live but here in Texas you can get it
>done for $100-200. Sounds like a lot but we just got a
>motor rebuilt for $1700 and that was with DH doing
>part of the work himself i.e. taking the motor apart,
>removing the motor and reinstalling the motor. My mom
>has to have her motor rebuilt and it is going to cost
>her $2500. Anyway, hope this is helpful.
>
>Corallyn
>
>
> >
> > I just asked my DH who drives a 86 F-150 (which is a
> > rattletrap by
> > the way) and he said it sounds like the
> > synchronizers. I asked what
> > your husband should do, and his wise answer was to
> > get the
> > transmission rebuilt. Not much help, sorry!
> >
> > Priss
> >
> >
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: truck repair question
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Corallyn, We live in CT and I think the cost would be way higher.  Thanks for asking dh about all this.  We ve put working on the truck aside for the
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Corallyn,
We live in CT and I think the cost would be way higher. Thanks for asking
dh about all this. We've put working on the truck aside for the moment and
I am now carless for a few days until we go to NY's Falcon Ridge Folk
Festival this week. We have too much to do.
Linda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: truck repair question
messages.msgSnippet: I asked my DH also and he said the same thing. I don t know where you live but here in Texas you can get it done for $100-200. Sounds like a lot but we just
messages.messageBody:
I asked my DH also and he said the same thing. I don't
know where you live but here in Texas you can get it
done for $100-200. Sounds like a lot but we just got a
motor rebuilt for $1700 and that was with DH doing
part of the work himself i.e. taking the motor apart,
removing the motor and reinstalling the motor. My mom
has to have her motor rebuilt and it is going to cost
her $2500. Anyway, hope this is helpful.

Corallyn


>
> I just asked my DH who drives a 86 F-150 (which is a
> rattletrap by
> the way) and he said it sounds like the
> synchronizers. I asked what
> your husband should do, and his wise answer was to
> get the
> transmission rebuilt. Not much help, sorry!
>
> Priss
>
>


__________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: truck repair question
messages.msgSnippet: I ll tell him what he said.  Dh has rebuilt plenty of transmissions on his vehicles so he can do that.  He was hoping to get someone to give him something a
messages.messageBody:
I'll tell him what he said. Dh has rebuilt plenty of transmissions on his
vehicles so he can do that. He was hoping to get someone to give him
something a bit more specific. So, he may possibley be rebuilding the
transmission when we get back from The Falcon Ridge Folk Festival in
Hillsdale, NY this coming week. Thanks very much for asking him!
Linda
----- Original Message -----
From: Priss <Priss1000@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, July 16, 2000 4:11 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: truck repair question

> I just asked my DH who drives a 86 F-150 (which is a rattletrap by
> the way) and he said it sounds like the synchronizers. I asked what
> your husband should do, and his wise answer was to get the
> transmission rebuilt. Not much help, sorry!
>
> Priss
